body:
I'm not sure to completely understand the issue, if the assumption was not met, it does not really matter whether the assumption error is a TestNG, JUnit or opentest4j one.

Can you clarify why this test did not behave as expected?

If I got it correctly, AssertJ throws `org.testng.SkipException` having TestNG in the classpath, but the test engine is JUnit 5 so the exception is not recognized, causing a test failure instead of skipping it.

Is that correct @ikhoon?

> If I got it correctly, AssertJ throws `org.testng.SkipException` having TestNG in the classpath, but the test engine is JUnit 5 so the exception is not recognized, causing a test failure instead of skipping it.

Yes, exactly. Since TestNG is in the classpath, we could not use `assumeThat()` with JUnit 5 that worked with ~4.17.1.

dumb suggestion: is it possible to migrate everything to JUnit5?

I feel the mix of TestNG and JUnit5 is a bit of an unusual situation.

If we decide to provide selecting the assumptions exception order, it would be in https://javadoc.io/doc/org.assertj/assertj-core/latest/org/assertj/core/configuration/Configuration.html.

> is it possible to migrate everything to JUnit5?

Yes. It is possible, but our team ‚ù§Ô∏è AssertJ's fluent assertions.

> I feel the mix of TestNG and JUnit5 is a bit of an unusual situation.

As I said, we have to check Reactive Streams implementations with technology compatibility kit that is out of control. üòÖ

> If we decide to provide selecting the assumptions exception order, it would be in javadoc.io/doc/org.assertj/assertj-core/latest/org/assertj/core/configuration/Configuration.html.

That sounds good to me. üëç

Alright, when I said migrating to JUnit5 I was really saying get rid of TestNG üòÑ .

I understand now it's not possible so let's go with selecting the assumption exception to throw from the config.

issue.title: Configure assumption exception

issue.body:

issue.title: Upgrade Iceberg to 1.8

repository.name: polaris
repository.description: Apache Polaris, the interoperable, open source catalog for Apache Iceberg

issue.body:
## Changes
- Migrate usage of `TableMetadata.addSchema` method
- Fix `ENDPOINTS` in `IcebergCatalogAdapter`
- Implement `initCatalog` method in `CatalogTests` 
- Config `PreferredAssumptionException` to JUnit5 in `PolarisRestCatalogIntegrationTest` and `BasePolarisCatalogTest`   due to:
   - `Assumptions.assertThat` of AssertJ, used in `CatalogTests` in Iceberg, is incompatible with Quarkus, see quarkusio/quarkus#46642.  
   -  **Next step:** Polaris handles empty namespaces differently than expected in [`listNamespacesWithEmptyNamespace`](https://github.com/apache/iceberg/blob/58b283e3533afce8b9884ac847a46eb40688353b/core/src/test/java/org/apache/iceberg/catalog/CatalogTests.java#L992-L1000). Consider whether to align this behavior.
- Fix [`createViewWithCustomMetadataLocation`](https://github.com/apache/iceberg/blob/58b283e3533afce8b9884ac847a46eb40688353b/core/src/test/java/org/apache/iceberg/view/ViewCatalogTests.java#L243-L272) in `QuarkusRestCatalogViewFileIT` and `QuarkusRestCatalogViewFileIntegrationTest` by ensuring that the `tempDir` remains within `BASE_LOCATION`.  
   - **Next step:** Decide whether to directly add the value of `write.metadata.path` to `AllowedLocations` in `BasePolarisCatalogViewBuilder` when specified by the user, similar to #193.
